thread.title: Samsung dual-camera tech patent could improve capture of moving images
thread.title_full: Samsung dual-camera tech patent could improve capture of moving images

author: Scott Adam Gordon
title: Samsung dual-camera tech patent could improve capture of moving images
text:
Samsung has submitted a patent for a dual-camera configuration which employs a telephoto lens and wide-angle camera, according to a new report. The patent filing, which was submitted in March 2016, was made public on December 29 and concerns a technology which would allow smartphones to more precisely capture moving images.
The application, titled “Digital Photographing Apparatus and Method of Operating the Same,” would use a wide-angle lens to capture a broad scene while the telephoto lens would be able to track a moving subject independently.

For example, if you were to take a photo of a street scene and a cyclist rode past, the telephoto lens would, in theory, capture the cyclist with a clarity similar to the static background.
The process is also said to work for videos, with the telephoto lens identifying and tracking the moving subject in real-time, without the user making any manual adjustment to the camera’s focus or settings.
See also: Samsung’s latest foldable display patent filings look pretty rad 6 hours ago The implication is that moving elements or objects in photos and videos would be captured with detail which isn’t currently possible on smartphones.
Though the patent filing was submitted early last year, it’s unclear when (or if) the technology will make it into a Samsung smartphone. It may be too soon for implementation in the Galaxy S8 , but usage in the potential Galaxy Note 8 is a possibility.
